sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Illinois Rivers-Friendly Farmer Program Act.

sections.heading: Program established.
sections.text:
The Department of Agriculture shall
establish the Illinois Rivers-Friendly Farmer Program to recognize farmers
helping to protect and enhance the State's rivers.

sections.heading: Purposes.
sections.text:
The program is intended
to
promote farming practices
that benefit rivers while maintaining farm profitability and to inform the
public about farmers' contributions to cleaning up of the rivers of Illinois.

sections.heading: A farmer seeking the "Rivers-Friendly Farmer"
sections.text:
designation may submit a written application to the Department of
Agriculture or an agency designated by the Department by rule.

sections.heading: Program criteria.
sections.text:
Farmers who satisfy all of the following
criteria applicable to their operations may be designated Rivers-Friendly
farmers:

sections.heading: Rules.
sections.text:
The Department of Agriculture shall adopt rules to
implement and administer this Act.

sections.heading: Processing Fee.
sections.text:
Any local Soil and Water Conservation District
that chooses to review a written application for the "Rivers-Friendly Farmer"
designation may collect a reasonable fee for services rendered.
